intro: Chaetanthera andina var. pratensis, commonly known as the Andean moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, yellow berries that contain the seeds. This species is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
